intro: Daucus blanchei, commonly known as the white carrot, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its root is not typically consumed but is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Daucus blanchei is known for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in rocky, high-altitude environments.
